page.title: 19SURVEY OF KINGSWAY CENTRE
page.content: Kingsway Baths was first opened in 1939 by Walter Elliot the Minister of Health At first there were just two swimming- pools and a sauna baths. Gradually as the years have gone by the council decided to close the small pool and build over it a new sports centre. Inter-city swimming and water polo matches are held in the centre. The cost of improving Kingsway baths has come to &500,000. In 1939 the total cost of building a completly new structure was &17,000. Now as the centre is nearly complete, the facilities availible are-Sports Hall, Minor Sports Hall,Activity Room,Creche Gymnasium,Swimming Pools,Intercity- Competitions,Sauna Solarium and Cafe. Popmobility and swimming are the most popular activities in the centre,and Wednesday & Thursday nights are the most popular. Charges are 40p-&2.00.
